titles.title: The Idolmaster Side M

偶像大师 SideM

relatedanime.anime: Idolmaster Side M: Wake Atte Mini!

anime.description: * Based on http://anidb.net/cr43171 [Bandai Namco Entertainment]`s digital idol-training card game. A group of young men leave their previous careers - including a lawyer and a doctor - behind to become male idols. Source: anime now

tag.name: idol
tag.description: In Japanese culture, idols (アイドル) are media personalities in their teens and early twenties who are considered particularly cute and cuddly and who will, for a period ranging from several months to a few years, regularly appear in the mass media, e.g. as singers for J-pop groups, bit-part actors, TV personalities, models in photo spreads published in magazines, advertisements, etc. Source: wiki

tag.name: dynamic
tag.description: Some of the central structural elements in anime are: Plot Continuity How does the plot or several plots unfold. Are they a strictly linear retelling of one big continuing story, a serial, possibly with several side stories, or is the content chopped into a set of unconnected episodes, only sharing the same setting and characters? Stereotype Characters Then there is the question of the character set presentation. Is it completely original, or is it your usual stereotypical character cast. Both choices have their merit, for example it would not really make much sense to reinvent the wheel for a harem anime. Fans of that genre come to expect their favourite stereotype protagonists. Plot Twists Finally there is the question of how complex the plot / the story unfolds. Are there side-plots that merge into the main plot leading to unexpected plot twists, or is the anime quite predictable? The latter would not be appropriate for detective stories. In harem anime on the other hand a foreseeable outcome is actually something the fans will come to expect.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: setting
tag.description: The setting describes in what time and place an anime takes place. To a certain extent it describes what you can expect from the world in the anime.

tag.name: time
tag.description: This placeholder lists different epochs in human history and more vague but important timelines such as the future, the present and the past.

tag.name: place
tag.description: The places the anime can take place in. Includes more specific places such as a country on Earth, as well as more general places such as a dystopia or a mirror world.

tag.name: present
tag.description: Somewhere between past and future.

tag.name: Earth
tag.description: The Earth is the third planet from the Sun, and the densest and fifth-largest of the eight planets in the Solar System. It is in effect a ball of hot mud, but on the surface it`s cold enough, so most of us live on it (or are supposed to). It is circa 4.5 billion years old, and, unless we humans succeed in destroying it over the next couple of centuries, it is expected to last for quite another while, though the changes in the Sun`s emissions due to its aging will likely cause the extinction of everything; the species of earthlings are guaranteed to die, even if we fail to kill them -- unless, of course, we find ourselves another planet and figure out a way to take everything there. Our little planet on a corner of this galaxy may mean nothing in the grand scheme of things, but to its inhabitants it is their home, so, as a species, we cherish it dearly, to the point many cultures even to this day deify it. Being the home to the human civilizations, the Earth is the main setting of most fiction, be it anime or otherwise, but not only are many titles set in other places, such as unrelated fantasy worlds, in a considerable number of fictional titles the Earth is actually destroyed by aggressive alien invaders.

tag.name: Japan
tag.description: Japan is a sovereign island nation in East Asia. Located in the Pacific Ocean, it lies off the eastern coast of the Asian mainland and stretches from the Sea of Okhotsk in the north to the East China Sea and China in the southwest. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: music
tag.description: Music anime generally revolves around people concerned with music in their everyday lives. In addition they often adhere to certain genre conventions, the emphasis on training and practice in preparation for competitions, characters desire for self improvement, and pursuit of a specific goal. This is not unlike the Sports category.

tag.name: game
tag.description: Based on an interactive (even if minimally so) form of entertainment software, generally available for PCs, consoles or arcade machines.

tag.name: Asia
tag.description: Asia is Earth`s largest and most populous continent, located primarily in the eastern and northern hemispheres and sharing the continental landmass of Eurasia with the continent of Europe. Asia covers an area of 44,579,000 square kilometers, about 30% of Earth`s total land area and 8.7% of the Earth`s total surface area. The continent, which has long been home to the majority of the human population, was the site of many of the first civilizations. Asia is notable for not only its overall large size and population, but also dense and large settlements as well as vast barely populated regions within the continent of 4.4 billion people. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: the arts
tag.description: The arts represent an outlet of human expression, usually influenced by culture, and driven by human creative impulse. Major constituents of the arts include literature – including poetry, novels and short stories, and epics; performing arts – among them music, dance, and theatre; culinary arts such as baking, chocolatiering, and winemaking; media arts like photography and film, and visual arts – including drawing, painting, and sculpting. Some art forms combine a visual element with performance (e.g. film) and the written word (e.g. comics). From prehistoric cave paintings to modern day films, art serves as a vessel for storytelling and conveying mankind`s relationship with its environment. Source: Wiki

tag.name: aim for the top
tag.description: This can be a positive or negative plot device. A character may strive to become the best in an altruistic way (e.g. best healer, most widely learned master), or it can be quite banal and primitive (e.g. challenged delinquents wanting to be the strongest fighters). Alas in fighting anime the latter usually prevails.

tag.name: Newtype Anime Award
tag.description: This anime has won 1 or more Newtype Anime Award(s)

tag.name: occupation and career
tag.description: The kind of anime which shows the career of a character, usually from the beginning.

tag.name: entertainment industry
tag.description: The show depicts how the entertainment industry works and how the main protagonists strive to cope with the sudden change to fame. At times this can be a very ugly sight indeed.

tag.name: ensemble cast
tag.description:
A show with an ensemble cast focuses on a larger group of main characters in a single plot narrative; anime containing several segmented plot narratives (such as episodic or arc-based plots) are excluded. As such, it doesn`t really have a "main" or "lead" character; instead, every member of the central main character group plays an important part in the show`s grander scheme; no single character is more important or prominent than the others (equality of importance). Further, subplots (if any) lead by each character in the ensemble have equal weighting in importance (or lack of weight).
* In a show where no single main character is more important or prominent than the others, 4+ main characters is almost always an ensemble cast. * A show with 3 main characters of equal importance is likely also an ensemble cast; equality of importance must be considered carefully. * A show with 2 main characters of equal importance is generally not an ensemble cast situation; however, on an exception basis where neither main character is considered an antagonist, a 2-main-character anime may be considered an ensemble (e.g. http://anidb.net/a11829 [Kimi no Na wa.]).
Pictured: http://anidb.net/a9043 [K (anime)]

tag.name: following one`s dream
tag.description: No matter what the hardships may be, at least one of the protagonists in this anime is following her/his dream. Examples: To become a professional athlete, a musician, a painter or the ruler of this world!

tag.name: predominantly male cast
tag.description: The anime features a mostly male cast, i.e. female characters are rare. Example: Reverse harem setting with a plethora of bishounen.

tag.name: technical aspects
tag.description: It may sometimes be useful to know about technical aspects of a show, such as information about its broadcasting or censorship. Such information can be found here.

character.name: Amagase Touma
character.description: Amagase Touma is the leader of the boygroup Jupiter.

character.name: Ijuuin Hokuto
character.description: Ijuuin Hokuto is the member of the boygroup Jupiter.

character.name: Mitarai Shouta
character.description: Mitarai Shouta is the member of the boygroup Jupiter.

character.name: Akizuki Ryou
character.description: Akizuki Ryou is the cousin of Akizuki Ritsuko and an idol from 876 Production. He is calm, soft, and all-around a cool and collected boy. In many ways, he is the opposite of his sometimes-harsh cousin. He carries an air of femininity, due to which he tends to be asked out by male classmates. Deeply worried by his feminine image and hoping to become more popular with the girls, Ryou has been considering becoming an idol for a long time, but when he visits the 765 Production office to discuss this idea with his cousin Ritsuko, she appears skeptical towards his plans. However, she is prepared to introduce him to Okamoto Manami, a manager at 876 Production. Manami, in deep trouble because of an 876 idol having become unable to perform at a live that is about to take place, is glad to accept Ryou as a substitute. Much to his disturbance, he has to go on stage dressed as a girl. Ritsuko, noticing Ryou`s charming on-stage appearance, decides that he should make his debut with 765 Production after all. Ryou immediately refuses because Ritsuko wants him to debut as a girl idol, and he does not like the idea of being toyed with by his cousin. He chooses to join 876 Production instead so he will be able to debut in his own way. However, when he is officially being taken in by 876 Production, president Ishikawa decides that Ryou will continue to perform as a female idol for the time being. His fans and his fellow 876 idols Hidaka Ai and Mizutani Eri are not aware that Ryou is actually male. Source: iM@S wiki

character.name: Jupiter
character.description: Jupiter is a boygroup consisting of http://anidb.net/ch34681 [Amagase Touma], http://anidb.net/ch36542 [Ijuuin Hokuto] and http://anidb.net/ch36543 [Mitarai Shouta].

episode.title: THE IDOLM@STER Prologue SideM Episode of Jupiter
The Idolmaster Prologue SideM: Episode of Jupiter
The Idolmaster Prologue SideM: Episode of Jupiter
episode.summary: The members of Jupiter — Amagase Touma, Mitarai Shouta, and Ijuuin Hokuto — are aiming to be the best in the idol industry. As their concerts start selling out and their popularity increase, they experience issues. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: アイドルマスター SideM 放送記念SP St@rting Ceremony
Idolmaster SideM Broadcast Commemoration Starting Ceremony
Idolmaster SideM Housou Kinen SP Starting Ceremony
ハッピースマイル
Happy Smile
Happy Smile
episode.summary: The members of Beit — Watanabe Minori, Takajou Kyouji, and Pierre — are shooting an video for the shopping district and decides to help out with their upcoming festival. In the midst of preparation, something happens to Pierre?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 飛び立つ勇気
Courage to Fly
Tobitatsu Yuuki
episode.summary: While Dramatic Stars — Tendou Teru, Kashiwagi Tsubasa, and Sakuraba Kaoru — prepare for their debut, they talk about their dream and goal as an idol. They are all anxious and excited, but Tsubasa seems to have something else on his mind... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: それぞれの輝き
Where Each Star Shines
Sorezore no Kagayaki
episode.summary: As the new members of 315 Productions make progress with their training, they are faced with an important question — who do they want to be as idols? In the meantime, Jupiter prepares for their next concert. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 理由あって, アイドル!
Idol with a Past
Riyuu Atte, Idol!
episode.summary: Tendou Teru is a lawyer whose dream is to make people smile. After one drunk night, he meets Kashiwagi Tsubasa and Sakuraba Kaoru through the Producer he met at a bar. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 海・合宿・315の夏!
Beach, Training Camp, Ultimate Summer!
Umi Gasshuku 315 no Natsu!
episode.summary: It`s time for training camp! The members of 315 Productions gets together to practice for their upcoming joint concert. With each aware of their own weaknesses, they work together to overcome the challenges. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 青春のリミット
Limit of Youth
Seishun no Limit
episode.summary: HighxJoker successfully debuts, and decides to film their own promotional video. Why did they all choose to join the band and where do they want to end up in the future? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 二人が選ぶVictory
Victory, Chosen by Both
Futari ga Erabu Victory
episode.summary: Producer gets hospitalized for overworking, and during his stay he meets Aoi Yuusuke and Aoi Kyousuke. How will their story affect him? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 先生よ, 大志を抱け!
Teachers, Be Ambitious!
Sensei yo, Taishi o Dake!
episode.summary: S.E.M`s first performance takes place at a prep school. How will the former high school teachers guide the students as an idol? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: どんな理由[わけ]も, どんな夢も,,,
No Matter the Reason, No Matter the Dream...
Donna Wake mo, Donna Yume mo,,,
episode.summary: Things get a little complicated at 315 Productions as Sakuraba starts acting on his own. How will everyone else at the agency react to the situation? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 風薫る日の決意
Resolution on a Breezy Day
Kazekaoru Hi no Ketsui
episode.summary: Productions finally announces to the public about their first concert. While everyone is practicing towards the live, Sakuraba seems to be doing something else...? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: sunset of youth
Sunset of Youth
Sunset of Youth
episode.summary: It`s time for cultural festival! Members of HighxJoker are busy preparing for their school`s cultural festival, but they receive work on the same day... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: Over AGAIN...
Over Again...
Over Again...
episode.summary: Members of 315 Productions continue their practice for their joint concert. While the members of Jupiter mentors the new idols, they reflect back on their past... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ずっと, ずっと, その先へ
Further and Further Still
Zutto, Zutto, Sono Saki e
episode.summary: It is finally the day of the 315 Productions joint concert! Source: crunchyroll
